Posted By: XTwistedsoulX (5/19/2010 2:24:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card feels like it was made to counter the famous 0-cmc suspend cards from Time Spiral set, however it also deals quite nicely with the Pact cycle from Future Sight.  
Taking a broader view, this card also deals quite nicely with Lotus and the moxes.  
  
Also works pretty well against 1-cmc spells, as countering a 1-cmc spell with this corresponds with having a [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) with a manacost of ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol). That being said, this card obviously weakens the higher cmc your opponents' spells have, however the buyback ability can still make is a real pain to deal with later in the game (i.e. you're at 8 lands and your opponent topdecks a 4-cmc spell).  
  
4/5  
  
Oh yeah, could this be used to repeatedly counter an opponent's commander in EDH? :)
posts.html:
This card feels like it was made to counter the famous 0-cmc suspend cards from Time Spiral set, however it also deals quite nicely with the Pact cycle from Future Sight.
Taking a broader view, this card also deals quite nicely with Lotus and the moxes.

Also works pretty well against 1-cmc spells, as countering a 1-cmc spell with this corresponds with having a Counterspell with a manacost of . That being said, this card obviously weakens the higher cmc your opponents' spells have, however the buyback ability can still make is a real pain to deal with later in the game (i.e. you're at 8 lands and your opponent topdecks a 4-cmc spell).

4/5

Oh yeah, could this be used to repeatedly counter an opponent's commander in EDH? :)

posts.post_content:
How can it be worse than [Spell Blast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spell Blast)? They are the same card, but this has Buyback...  
  
Nice card, however... Not game breaking, unless you have a HUGE amount of mana, but nice... Worked very well with the Urza-tron!  
3.5/5
